page.title: 03RIVER SURVEY
page.content: The river which flows through this area is called{The Aln,}from the { {Saxon "alain"}meaning{clear.}We looked at a section of the river at{Peter's {Mill.}The birds we saw were mainly swifts and swallows but there were some coots.Most of the animals were rodents;rats,water voles and shrews and we also found a badger's hole.There were many midges and flies.On the river there were pond skaters and water boatmen.In the river there were common leeches and we discovered one{horse leech}and some mayfly nymphs.There were lots of sticklebacks with their young and a few minnows.The river was very clear,clean and seemed to be unpolluted,so at this point at any rate it is still worthy of its name.
